pull.title: Peers tab hide horizontal scroll bars

events.body:
The horizontal scrollbars block click access to rows in the table view and detail view.
The vertical scrollbars are useful. The horz. bars are not very useful (IMO).

### Before:

![](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23396902/117111892-4157d500-ad56-11eb-82b1-5bd3e88a4cff.png)

### After: 

![Screen Shot 2021-05-11 at 7 28 39 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/152159/117896698-1fe37580-b28f-11eb-9cb9-8c9bb1b10584.png)
I don't see a reason to hide them, especially considering that the default policy is `Qt::ScrollBarAsNeeded`.
I don't think this is an improvement, UX-wise. Under this change, the user does not have visual feedback that there is more data to be seen if they scroll horizontally.

events.body:
Agree with @promag 
> I don't see a reason to hide them, especially considering that the default policy is `Qt::ScrollBarAsNeeded`.

and with @jarolrod 
> It's a NACK from me on removing the horizontal scroll bar from the Peers Table. The user can be left in a state where it is inconvenient to scroll right to see the rest of the content. This is a UX downgrade.

How does/should the user toggle/hide the detail widget when the table data fills the view?

![Screen Shot 2021-05-19 at 4 08 21 PM 2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/152159/118882565-5427e900-b8c2-11eb-8c77-015c37f84c9a.png)
![Screen Shot 2021-05-19 at 4 08 55 PM 2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/152159/118882581-57bb7000-b8c2-11eb-91c0-081103371a69.png)

Maybe assigning a key command to hide/toggle the detail view would work? \<ESC\> key?
But I believe it is optimal to allow for a mouse click event as well as a key command event.
